meanings.definition: To include or form into a corporation again.
meanings.sent1: After the merger, the company decided to reincorporate its subsidiaries.
meanings.sent2: The board voted to reincorporate the business as a limited liability company.
meanings.sent3: The small business owner joked that he would have to reincorporate just to keep up with the paperwork!
meanings.sent4: The team leader suggested they reincorporate their strategies for better efficiency.
meanings.sent5: She had to reincorporate her ideas into the new business plan to align with the company's goals.

meanings.definition: To reintegrate or bring back into a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to reincorporate the student who had been absent for a week.
meanings.sent2: The organization decided to reincorporate members who had left due to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The lost puppy was finally reincorporated into the loving arms of its owner.
meanings.sent4: The missing puzzle piece was reincorporated into the picture, completing the image.
meanings.sent5: He felt relieved to reincorporate his best friend into their close-knit group after a misunderstanding.
